tr.td: Nutmegs, Cinnamon, Cloves, and Mace, Importation of regulated.

License for Importation, under Hands of Commissioners of Customs, granted without Fee.
See 6& 7 W.&M.c.7.§ 2,3.
For repealing such Parts of several former Acts as prevent or prohibit the Importation of Foreign Brandy, Aqua Vitæ, and other Spirits, and Bacon, except from France.
Statutes 18 Car. II. c.2.–20 Car. II. c.7. virtually repealed or suspended by continuing the Duties on Bacon imported, granted by 4 W. &M. c.5. § 1.
Saltpetre, Importation allowed for One Year.

Alamodes and Lustrings, Regulations as to Imporation of.
See 8 & 9 W. III. c. 36. § 3–5. Importation of Foreign-wrought Silks and Velvets prohibited for a limited time, 6G. III. c. 28. which is continued by many subsequent Acts, last continued until June 1808, 43 G. III. c. 133. § 2. and made perpetual, 48 G. III. c. 22. § 3.

entry.head: Informations See Court of King's Bench.
Insuring to deliber Prohibited Goods, or Goods without Custom Duty

tr.td:
Penalties.
How these Penalties recovered, 8 & 9 W. III. c. 36. § 2.

entry.head: Interregnum since 11th Dec. 1688, and before the 13th Feb. following

tr.td: All Offences and Actions during the Interregnum may be prosecuted and sued; and in Action, Declaration, Indictment, and Information, the Year of our Lord to be alleged instead of the King's Reign, and to conclude contra pacem Regni.
Recognizances to the late King James II. may be sued in the Name of the King and Queen and their Successors.
Statute 22 & 23 C. II. C.10. for settling Intestate Estates, explained by Stat.29 C.II.c.3.§ 25. and continued by Stat.30 C.II. c.6. All the said Act and Clauses made perpetual.
Administrators not compelled to account, except by Inventory, but at the Suit of Parties interested.
Brother and Sister of Intestale, and their Representatives, to share equally with the Mother.
Proviso in the Statute 22 & 23 Car. II.c.10. for the Customs of London and Province of York, not to extend to Intestate's Estate claimedlby Administrator quatenus Administrator.
For the better Security and Relief of the Protestant Subjects in Ireland.
The Irish Parliament, and all Acts, &c. since 13th Feb.1688, except by, from, or under the King, declared void.
All Cities and Corporations in Ireland to be in the same State as they were in 1683, notwithstanding Quo Warrantos, &c. which are declared void.
No Person shall be prejudiced by his Absence since 25th Dec.1665, or for Nonpayment of Rent &c. to the King, since 25th Dec.1688, until the Time that Ireland shall be reduced.
Forcible Detinue against Persons detaining Possessions.
For the abrogating the Oath of Supremacy in Ireland, and appointing other Oaths.
The Oath made in Ireland, Stat.2 Eliz. c. 1. I. abrogated.
The Persons who are bound to take the new Oaths described.
Persons within 30 Miles of Dublin to take them in the Chancery or King's Bench.
Persons above 30 Miles off, in the Sessions; and also repeat the Declaration—Fee.
Clergymen not taking the Oaths, &c. Penalty; other Persons offending, Penalty.
Barristers, &c. to take the Oath, before admitted to Practice.
All Persons who were to take the abrogated Oath, to take this Oath and the Declaration.
No Member of either House of Parliament to sit before he has taken the new Oath and Declaration.
How Oaths, &c. to be taken by Peers and Members.
Clerk of each House to record the same—Fee.
Peers, Members of Parliament, Barristers, &c. offending, Punishment, and also Penalty £500.
Persons to whom this Act shall not extend.
Proviso for W. Harbord, Esq. holding the Place of Vice-Treasurer of Ireland.
Irish Archbishops, &c. being in England at Hilary Term 1691, shall take the Oaths here, and likewise in Ireland.
Not taking the Oaths here, Penalty.
All other Officers in Ireland, being here, shall take the Oaths here—Penalty.
Such other Officers taking the Oaths as herein, effectual as if resident in Ireland, and had taken the Oaths there.
Proviso for Persons who were in Irish Garrisons, &c. and have submitted to the King.
Barristers, &c. claiming to be exempt from taking Oaths, &c. must make their Claim in Michelmas Term next.
Barrister, &c. practising before he has sworn, Penalty £500, and Disability.
Justices of Peace to give the Oath of Allegiance to all Persons of 18 and upwards.
Declaration appointed for Quakers in place of Oaths.
Taking Declaration does not make them capable of Office.

The Act not to be dispensed with by Letters Patent, &c.
See Doll.

entry.head: Iron, Copper, and Mundick Metal See Exportation
Iudgments See Court of King's Bench. London, City of.

tr.td: Ancient Usage of Cities, Boroughs, &c. of returning Jurors, Proviso for.
Talesmen of £5 per Ann. Proviso for.
Officer taking Fee for returning Tales—Penalty £10.
Writ de non ponend" grantable but upon Oath.

Continuance of Act as to Return of Jurors, 3 Years, &c.
This Act continued, 7 & 8 W. III. c. 32. § 10.–1 Ann. St. 2.c.13. § 2.–3 & 4 Ann c. 18. § 3.—10 Ann. c.14.§ 4.—9 G. I. c. 8.§ 2. See 3 G. II. c. 25. which is made perpetual, 6G. II. c. 37. § 1.
See Sales.
